AlertConditionComparator.description:
How to compare the alert condition metric to the value.

 - EQUAL: The metric equals the value.
 - NOT_EQUAL: The metric does not equal the value.
 - GREATER_THAN: The metric is greater than the value.
 - GREATER_THAN_EQUAL_TO: The metric is greater than or equal to the value.
 - LESS_THAN: The metric is less than the value.
 - LESS_THAN_EQUAL_TO: The metric is less than or equal to the value.
 - DOES_EXIST: The value of the metric exists.
 - DOES_NOT_EXIST: The value of the metric does not exist.
 - REGEX: A result is produced when the metric is applied to the regular expression value.
 - DOES_NOT_REGEX: No result is produced when the metric is applied to the regular expression value.
 - CONTAINS: The metric contains the value.
 - DOES_NOT_CONTAIN: The metric does not contain the value.

DataMatrix.description: A set of time series containing a range of data points over time for each time series

DataMatrixResult.description: Time series containing a range of data points over time for each time series

unixTime.description: The time that a data point was recorded

DataVector.description: A set of time series containing a single sample for each time series, all sharing the same timestamp

DataVectorResult.description: Time series containing a single sample for each time series, all sharing the same timestamp

MetricsData.description: The data points in a metrics collection

PatchHttpConfigurationHeaderValue.description: The value of the headers for a monitor update request.

UpdateMonitorRequestIpVersionValue.description: The value of the IP version for a monitor update request.

UpdateMonitorRequestLocationsValue.description: The value of the locations for a monitor update request.

url.description:
The URL of the service that will be monitored.

The URL must begin with an HTTP scheme of 'http' or 'https'.

method.description: The HTTP method used when the monitor makes a request to the service.

body.description: A base64 encoded HTTP request body to use when a monitor checks the service.

validateCertificate.description: A flag for validating a service's certificate.

UpdateMonitorRequestPatchHttpConfigurati.description: The HTTP configuration for a monitor update request.

username.description: The username used for basic authentication by a monitor.

password.description: The password used for basic authentication by a monitor.

UpdateMonitorRequestPatchHttpConfigurati.description: Basic authentication for the HTTP configuration of a monitor update request.

publicCertificate.description: The X.509 PEM formatted public certificate used for authentication.

privateKey.description: The X.509 PEM formatted private key used for authentication.

caBundle.description: The X.509 PEM formatted certificate authority bundle used for authentication.

UpdateMonitorRequestPatchHttpConfigurati.description: The certificates for the HTTP configuration of a monitor update request.

username.description: The username used for digest authentication by a monitor.

password.description: The password used for digest authentication by a monitor.

UpdateMonitorRequestPatchHttpConfigurati.description: Digest authentication for the HTTP configuration of a monitor update request.

host.description: The host address of the service to monitor.

port.description: The port of the service to monitor.

data.description: Base64 encoded TCP data to send to the monitored service

UpdateMonitorRequestPatchTcpConfiguratio.description: The TCP configuration for a monitor update request.

cityCode.description: A location's city, expressed as an IATA airport code

countryCode.description: A location's ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 country code

ipAddresses.description:
The IP addresses of a location

The IP addresses where monitoring checks originate from.

hasIpv4.description: Whether or not a location supports IPv4 monitoring checks.

hasIpv6.description: Whether or not a location supports IPv6 monitoring checks.

monitoringv2Location.description: A location which performs monitoring checks.

totalCount.description: The total number of items in the dataset

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether or not a previous page of data exists

hasNextPage.description: Whether or not another page of data is available

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the set of data returned

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the set of data returned

paginationPageInfo.description:
Information about a paginated response

This is modeled after the GraphQL Relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination.

errorType.description: The type of error encountered when querying for metrics

error.description: The error encountered when querying for metrics

warnings.description: Warnings encountered when querying for metrics

id.description: The unique identifier for an alert condition.

monitorId.description: The monitor identifier associated with an alert condition.

value.description: The value to check to determine if an alert should be generated.

alarmDelay.description:
The amount of time to wait before sending an alert.

This is useful to prevent alerts due to a flapping service.

alarmEvery.description: How often an alert should be generated if an alert condition is still being met.

alarmUntilSilenced.description: A flag that determines if an alert should continue to trigger until it is resolved.

enabled.description: Whether an alert condition is enabled or not.

minimumLocations.description:
The minimum number of locations that the alert condition must be triggered for before an alert is generated.

This should always be less than or equal to the number of locations a monitor has.

createdAt.description: The date an alert condition was created.

updatedAt.description: The date an alert condition was last updated.

v2AlertCondition.description: The conditions required to generate an alert.

v2AlertConditionMetric.description:
The metric to compare in an alert condition.

 - STATUS: The status metric for an alert condition. This condition allows for alerting based on a monitor being 'UP', 'DOWN', or 'SLOW'.
 - CODE: The HTTP status code for an alert condition

conditionIds.description: The alert condition IDs to delete.

monitorIds.description: The list of monitor IDs to delete.

alarmDelay.description:

alarmEvery.description: How often an alert should be generated if an alert condition is still being met.

alarmUntilSilenced.description: A flag that determines if an alert should continue to trigger until it is resolved.

enabled.description: Whether an alert condition is enabled or not.

minimumLocations.description:

This should always be less than or equal to the number of locations a monitor has.

v2CreateAlertConditionResponse.description: A response from a request to create an alert condition.

locations.description: The IDs of locations to monitor from

interval.description: How often a monitor should be checked.

timeout.description: How long to wait before timing out a monitor check request to a service.

enabled.description: Whether a monitor is enabled or not.

v2CreateMonitorResponse.description: A response from a request to create a monitor.

v2GetAlertConditionResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve an alert condition.

v2GetAlertConditionsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a monitor's alert conditions.

results.description: The list of monitoring locations for a stack.

v2GetLocationsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve locations.

v2GetMonitorErrorsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve errors for a monitor.

locations.description: The requested locations of the monitor.

v2GetMonitorLocationsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a monitor's locations.

v2GetMonitorResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a monitor.

v2GetMonitorsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a stack's monitors.

url.description:
The URL of the service to monitor

The URL must begin with a case insensitive HTTP scheme of 'http' or 'https'.

method.description: The HTTP method used when the monitor makes a request to the service.

body.description: A base64 encoded HTTP request body to use when a monitor checks the service.

headers.description: A list of HTTP headers to add to the request when a monitor checks a service.

validateCertificate.description: Whether or not to validate a service's certificate.

username.description: The username used for basic authentication by a monitor.

password.description: The password used for basic authentication by a monitor.

publicCertificate.description: The X.509 PEM formatted public certificate used for authentication.

privateKey.description: The X.509 PEM formatted private key used for authentication.

caBundle.description: The X.509 PEM formatted certificate authority bundle used for authentication.

v2HttpConfigurationClientCertificate.description: The certificates used by a monitor for authentication against the service being monitored.

username.description: The username used for digest authentication by a monitor.

password.description: The password used for digest authentication by a monitor.

v2IpVersion.description:
The IP version of a monitor

The IP version defines which type of location a monitor can run from.  Not all locations support both IP versions.

 - IPV4: An IPv4 monitor
 - IPV6: An IPv6 monitor

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the most recent monitoring check from the location.

responseTime.description: The response time of the most recent monitoring check from the location.

v2LocationWithAnalytics.description:
A location with additional metrics

The additional metrics provide status and response times about recent monitor checks for a location.

name.description:
The name of a monitor

A monitor's name

uptimePercentage.description: The percent of time a monitored service has had a status of UP or SLOW in the last hour

avgResponseTime.description: The average response time for a monitor

locations.description: The locations a service is monitored from.

interval.description:
The amount of time between each monitor check.

By default each service monitor will be checked every five minutes.

timeout.description: Then length of time to wait until the monitor check times out.

createdAt.description: The date a monitor was created.

updatedAt.description: The date a monitor was last updated.

enabled.description: Whether or not a monitor is enabled.

v2Monitor.description: An instance of a service monitor

monitorId.description: The monitor identifier associated with the error.

locations.description: A list of locations that have the error.

error.description: The error text for a monitor error.

createdAt.description: The date a monitor error was created.

v2MonitorError.description: An error that ocurred during a monitoring check.

v2MonitorStatus.description:
The status of a monitor

- UNKNOWN: Unable to determine the status of the service being monitored. This is likely due to a new monitor that has not been checked yet.
 - UP: The status of the service being monitored is up.
 - DOWN: The status of the service being monitored is down.
 - SLOW: The status of the service being monitored is slow. A service with a slow status means the service is up but responses are taking longer than 500 milliseconds.

locations.description: The list of locations a monitor is checked from.

interval.description: How often a monitor is checked.

timeout.description: The amount of time to wait before a monitor check times out.

enabled.description: Whether a monitor is enabled or not.
